newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Taiwan foreign minister lands in South Africa.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan foreign minister lands in South Africa.

text.p: Taiwanese Foreign Minister John Chang arrived in Johannesburg on Sunday for talks with his South African counterpart Alfred Nzo, officials of the two sides said.
Chang declined to speak to reporters on arrival at Johannesburg airport. He scheduled a news conference for later on Sunday after meeting with Nzo.
President Nelson Mandela said last year South Africa had decided to ditch Taiwan in favour of establishing diplomatic ties with mainland China.
Beijing regards Taiwan as a renegade province and refuses to establish formal ties with countries that recognise Taipei's sovereignty.
